name: Mandarin Oriental, Miami

reviews.text: I took my mother, who lives in south florida, on a long weekend to detox and relax. The hotel had a great rate for floridians. When we got there, they said they had "bad news". The room we had book, a bayside twin bed " was not available..so they gave us a suite...for no extra charge!! It was ver ylarge and comfortable and the bathroom was enormous. The balcony was the length of the room with beautiful views. There were two tv's (not flat panel but who cares). The decor was minimalist, not plush but comfortable and in perfect condition. Housekeeping was discreet and capable.
reviews.title: Great food and spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was fortunate that the room was so big as I got ill and for 36 hours had to take to my bed..not a bad place to be sick tho.
reviews.title: Never wanted to check out

reviews.text: The Azul was closed but we took out meals at the Cafe Sambal..the sea bass is to die for and the pad thai is beautful.. The hotel does a great mojito as well.
reviews.title: amazing

reviews.text: Breakfast was great but too big. If you are paying extra, I suggest splitting one breakfast for two.
reviews.title: Could be much better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thee beach was a disappointment as it is really just some sand with loungers and you cannot acces the water. The pool was beautiful if a bit small, but as it was off season it was empty at most times.
reviews.title: Pretty Good...But...
Well below expectations
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Mandarin for 3 nights at the end of February. We were assigned a room, and told that the bellman would be up with our luggage shortly. Unfortunately, when we got up to the room, we realized that we were not the only guests staying there - someone's whole luggage (including a women's purse) was spread out in the room. We went downstairs, received a lukewarm apology (the bellman was more apologetic about the situation), and were assigned another room - turns out this one is a lower category than what we paid for! My husband called the front desk, where they told him that the hotel was completely sold out and that the soonest they would be able to move us would be hopefully the next day - after I got on the phone (I am currently 5 months pregnant and had just about enough for one day) they said that a bellman would be up right away with a new key for another room. It took 2 more calls and a total of 45 minutes to have this happen.

reviews.title: tripadvisor review right on the money
reviews.text: More unpleasantries. There was another guest staying in the hotel with the same last name as me. Surely something that happens quite often in large places, as my name is not uncommon. This issue, however, was too much for the Mandarin staff. The front desk, the spa, the concierge and even the pool bar ALL confused our names, despite the fact that every time I called I left my room number. We received the other guests confirmations for spa appointments, were billed for their food, given their restaurant reservations. Again, a barely lukewarm apology from the front desk regarding our issues at checkout, even as they were taking the other guests charges off our bill.

reviews.title: The best in the City
reviews.text: Also, the directions the concierge desk gave to any location were always wrong - this was shocking to us since there were multiple staff giving us directions at different times!

reviews.title: very enjoyable
reviews.text: We did try the spa, and found both therapists very good for the massages (I had the prenatal massage, my husband deep tissue).

reviews.title: Got Engaged here...
reviews.text: We would not return to this location, rather opting for the Four Seasons where our experiences have always been positive. Further, based on this stay, I doubt we would ever stay at the Mandarin chain again.
I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for a conference, and it was unfortunate I was traveling by myself because the hotel and its location are fantastic.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel and Staff

reviews.text: The hotel itself is situated on Biscayne Bay. I was fortunate to get a room facing the bay and took full advantage of the private balcony that comes standard with every room. (Have a room service breakfast on that balcony and you'll know what I mean)
reviews.title: Great Business Hotel

reviews.text: The room itself was done in rich mahogany and the bed was extremely comfortable and very sleepworthy. The bathrooms were superlative and done in marble. It was really a nice treat to sleep at night with the windows to the balcony open and the ocean breeze blowing in.
reviews.title: Great Stay in Downtown Miami

reviews.text: In regard to items outside the room, the lounge on the lobby floor of the hotel was superb and as you would expect also provides great views of the bay. The pool scene is also top notch, but the wait service by the pool could have been more timely. There is a walking/jogging path that winds around the hotel and hugs the bay through some adjacent condo buildings.
reviews.title: Nice, BUT...

likes.disliked: — the lobby and general airport vibe of the place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only minor downside I would state is the ability to walk to anywhere notable from the hotel. Its location on the bay also puts it at almost a required taxi (especially given Miami's heat) to anywhere notable. But taxis are always available and immediately summoned by one of the valets. However, given that significant upside of the views based on the hotel's location, this would be a trade-off I would make anytime.
reviews.title: A destination onto itself - Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel lives up to its reputation. From the minute we arrived the staff were nothing but helpful and friendly. We mentioned that it was our anniversary and got upgraded to a better room with a view overlooking the bay. The hotel just oozes class, with a beautiful lobby, great rooms and friendly efficient staff.
reviews.title: Luxury in the sun

likes.disliked: — Too many sunbeds at the pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The one slight negative is the pool area is slightly small with too many sunbeds packed into the space. However the staff are great at the pool, they come round with free iced water and differnt ice creams throughout the day. It's a nice touch and makes you feel special. The pool itself is nice and was not that busy when we were there.
reviews.title: Luxury

reviews.text: The cost of the hotel and everything in it is not cheap but then you have to be willing to pay premium prices for a good 5 star hotel.
reviews.title: Not quite MO

reviews.text: Overall a great hotel in a good location.
reviews.title: A Business Trip ath the Mandarin Oriental Miami

reviews.text: Returned from honeymoon tour of the USA and this was clearly the best hotel we stayed. Such a great spot for downtown and biscayne bay views and our room was immaculate. As being such a high profile hotel, we were dreading ignorant staff and expensive prices but we found the opposite in both cases. Every member of staff we dealt with were very friendly and professional. The room bar, room service and pool bar were more than average as you would expect in a 5star but well within budget for the surroundings where we were and not a complete rip off as some other places are.
reviews.title: WOW!
Mandarin is a class act all of the way...
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel over Labor Day Weekend with our 6month old baby. The hotel staff was fabulous. Many staff members remembered baby's name and ours. Azul tasting menu is superb. Sushi Cafe Sambal was really nice for a hotel in Miami. We stayed 3 days and never had reason to leave the hotel. The hotel is exceptionally clean which is a must for us. No complaints about this mini-vacation... Only that the pool could be a bit bigger.

I stayed at this hotel on a number of occasions and it always has been an excellent experience. The rooms are very comfortable and stylishly decorated. Service is friendly and efficient. The hotel is very expensive in high season but in the summer it is the best value for money in the area. Overall, it is probably the best hotel in Miami. It goes without saying that this hotel is not at the beach as it is in Miami and not Miami Beach, but if you have a car it doesn’t matter as you can go to any beach you like.
reviews.title: Great Miami Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from two nights/three days at the Mandarin. It was fabulous. It's worth staying here for the gorgeous views of Biscayne Bay all around. The hotel is located on an island and there is a lovely jogging, park area that can be enjoyed. The locals call this are "little manhattan" and it is aptly nicknamed. The hotel is very oriental in decor and rather minimalist in design but made for a beautiful building. The room was well appointed, bedding comfortable and a nice balcony. The service was superb on every occasion. We enjoyed the pool area and ate in the restaurants onsite. The only qualifier here is the prices are also 5-star. Valet parking pricey and the cost of drinks at the bar were the highest I've encountered (outside of NY). Also, this is not a resort and not the hotel for you if you are looking for a beach trip to FL. The beach is a short drive away (10 minutes, plus time for find parking). But, if you want a hotel convenient in the city of Miami, with great service this is it.
reviews.title: Five Star All the Way!

likes.liked: — The service. The staff is incredibly well-trained.

reviews.title: service at this hotel is a joke
reviews.text: Everything in this hotel feels like a joke
Service- terrible
reviews.title: OK for Business

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved staying here. The service was excellent, the restaurants were superb! We even had rose pedals on our bed in honor of our anniversary. Our anniversary dinner included a complimentary dessert with a written message in chocolate. From the bellmen to the maid service, everyone and everything lived up to its name. The staff at the pool were accommodating. Room service arrived promptly. The bathroom was to die for. The views from our balconey were great. They even had a menorah next to the Christmas tree in the lobby. The only fault was with the Concierge, his directions were not accurate and he took care of phone calls before people standing in front of him.
reviews.title: 40th Anniversary Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and myself stayed at hotel September 2005. We've stayed at various hotels in the MO Group including Bangkok, London Toyo and Hong Kong and this one really lived up to our expectations. We had a spectacular suite on the penultimate floor with a balcony which swept right round the side of the hotel. We could have held a party for 50 poeple on the balcony alone! The views os the bay and Downtown Miami were absolutely phenomenal.
reviews.title: Star spotting at the pool!
Great Hotel, Great Location
reviews.text: One of the highlights of our stay was going for a swim and realising that we were shaing the pool with a certain actor of Irish extraction who was staying there whilefilming the movie Miami Vice.

Our suite was beautifully decorated with an incredible bathroom. The restaurants were of a high standard although you had to make sure to book well in advance for the main one, as no priority was given to residents.
reviews.title: Stay somewhere else - waste of money!

likes.liked: — Water from Voss, the spa and the pool.

reviews.text: Only disappointment was the bar which was situated at the end of the lobby. It seemed like more of an afterthought than an actual bar. Cocktails were good though...
reviews.title: PAST ITS PRIME ?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from a 2 night stay at the Mandarin. Very pleased with our experience. The hotel during the day doesn't seem like much as far as decor goes but at night it's transformed, due to great lighting, into a very chic hotel. The staff is extremely helpful & friendly--maybe not as top notch as the Four Seasons which is across the bay--but still very good.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!!

likes.disliked: — lots of kids at the pool

reviews.text: Ate at Cafe Sambal--food was excellent. In fact, the two restaurants at this hotel are worth staying here alone. Also ate at Azul (my second time) and it did not disappoint. The service is 5 star as well as the food. Only one complaint--could not believe that a family had decided to bring their 2 year old in here and at 10:30pm!!! I was told by our waiter that it's a cultural thing & there's not much they can do.
reviews.title: Soooooo fabulous!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Took advantage of the spa too--pedicure--good but not $88 good. But the facial was one of the best I've ever had. Ask for Courtney & the reguvenation facial. Relaxing, amazing--no extractions or deep cleansing on this one though. It was a nice change.
reviews.title: A beautiful city hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel & would definitely return!
reviews.title: WOW... I MEAN... WOW

likes.disliked: — no choice but to valet park.

reviews.text: I have stayed at lots of hotels and this is the nicest one I've ever stayed at. Simply fabulous!!
reviews.title: Beautiful but pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have always been a big Mandarin Oriental fan but must confess that the Miami one was a disappointment and I would not return. The famed Martini bar is very small and the infinity pool minute (three strokes and you've reached the other end). The service, although always given with a smile, is slow and the automatic gratuity added to the bill simply an irritant. Moreover, should you go onto the private beach section, be sure to spray yourself with anti-bug bite spray as otherwise you will be eaten alive.
reviews.title: Something of a disappointment in comparison with other MOs

likes.liked: — The room, bathroom and the bed linen.
likes.disliked: — The level of service and the lack of buzz in the hotel.

reviews.text: But on a more positive note, their restaurant Azul is superb and having the Tasting Menu is a must.
reviews.title: 2 Star Service at a 5 Star Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Mandarin and expected much better service than I received. The service turned bad when I returned to my room to change for the evening and realized that the hanger that I brought with me to hang my suit on was missing from the room. I searched all over because even at 2 star hotels the maids know not to throw anything away unless it is in the trash can. Well the maid threw it away so I had nothing to hang my suit on for my travel back home. I then called the housekeeper to get them to bring me a replacement "plastic hanger" but was delivered a bulky wooden hanger. They later brought me a wire hanger, once again not what I asked for. When I spoke to the manager on duty he assured me that he would get what I needed but he never even called to say that he couldn't get it. I guess I was a little dissappointed since I am accustomed to the Ritz who will send someone across town to get whatever it is that you desire if they don't have it there. I have to say that when I checked out the lady at the front desk was very apologetic and tried to compensate me for my inconvenience. So FYI, don't leave anything lying around that you don't want to be thrown away. Other than that, the hotel was wonderful.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Madarin Oriental for 2 nights at the end of October with my parents and my now new fiance. When we checked in we were giving an upgrade to a bay view which was lovely and having got such a good deal due to the time of year we were even more pleased. The hotel was fairly empty during our stay but I liked it as the there was plenty of room round the pool. The staff's attention to detail was excellent, on the trip my boyfriend actually proposed and had asked one of the hotel staff to set up our room for us. When we arrived back from shopping I walked into our beautiful room with candles round the bath and rose petals on the bed and a sushi shaped cake, it was lovely.
reviews.title: Great stay

likes.disliked: — Slow valet parking & somewhat cold staff

reviews.text: The manager of the hotel was very friendly and extremely helpful.
reviews.title: Make Mine Mandarin

description: The Forbes Five-Star, AAA Five Diamond city resort, Mandarin Oriental, Miami is situated on a prime waterfront site featuring unobstructed views of Biscayne Bay and the Miami downtown skyline. The waterfront property features 326 spacious rooms with 31 suites.
